intro: Calymmandra candida, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its showy, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and is often found in moist, shaded areas. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Calymmandra candida is typically grown as a perennial in gardens and can thrive in USDA hardiness zones 9 through 11.
